trans-unit.source: Specifies a directory to which the Network Client will send JDBC trace information. If the program or session has multiple connections, the Network Client creates a separate file for each connection. By default, the files are named _driver_0, _driver_1, and so on. Use the traceFile=path attribute to specify a file name for the trace file.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies a directory to which the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Client will send JDBC trace information.
If the program or session has multiple connections, the Network Client creates a separate file for each connection.
By default, the files are named <codeph>_driver_0</codeph>, <codeph>_driver_1</codeph>, and so on.
Use the traceFile=path attribute to specify a file name for the trace file.

target.mrk: Specifies a directory to which the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Client will send JDBC trace information.
If the program or session has multiple connections, the Network Client creates a separate file for each connection.
By default, the files are named <codeph>_driver_0</codeph>, <codeph>_driver_1</codeph>, and so on.
Use the traceFile=path attribute to specify a file name for the trace file.

trans-unit.source: If the directory does not exist, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> issues an error message. If you do not specify an absolute path name, the directory is assumed to be relative to the current directory.

seg-source.mrk: If the directory does not exist, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> issues an error message.
If you do not specify an absolute path name, the directory is assumed to be relative to the current directory.

target.mrk: If the directory does not exist, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> issues an error message.
If you do not specify an absolute path name, the directory is assumed to be relative to the current directory.

trans-unit.source: For more information about tracing, see "Network client tracing" in the . See traceFile=path, traceFileAppend=true, and traceLevel=value for other attributes related to tracing.

seg-source.mrk: For more information about tracing, see "Network client tracing" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph>.
See traceFile=path, traceFileAppend=true, and traceLevel=value for other attributes related to tracing.

target.mrk: For more information about tracing, see "Network client tracing" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph>.
See traceFile=path, traceFileAppend=true, and traceLevel=value for other attributes related to tracing.

trans-unit.source: You can combine this attribute with other attributes.

seg-source.mrk: You can combine this attribute with other attributes.

target.mrk: You can combine this attribute with other attributes.

trans-unit.source: -- enable tracing on an existing database that will have multiple connections jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/mydb;traceDirectory=/home/mydir/mydbtracedir -- specify a trace file name within the directory jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/mydb;traceDirectory=/home/mydir/mydbtracedir;traceFile=trace.out -- append to the default trace file jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/mydb;traceDirectory=/home/mydir/mydbtracedir;traceFileAppend=true

seg-source.mrk: -- enable tracing on an existing database that will have multiple connections jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/mydb;traceDirectory=/home/mydir/mydbtracedir -- specify a trace file name within the directory jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/mydb;traceDirectory=/home/mydir/mydbtracedir;traceFile=trace.out -- append to the default trace file jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/mydb;traceDirectory=/home/mydir/mydbtracedir;traceFileAppend=true

target.mrk: -- enable tracing on an existing database that will have multiple connections jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/mydb;traceDirectory=/home/mydir/mydbtracedir -- specify a trace file name within the directory jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/mydb;traceDirectory=/home/mydir/mydbtracedir;traceFile=trace.out -- append to the default trace file jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/mydb;traceDirectory=/home/mydir/mydbtracedir;traceFileAppend=true
